1139914485622345728.text: There is no credible evidence that vaccines cause autism. I'm sorry for whatever difficulties you or your son have to deal with because of his condition, but correlation does not imply causation. The science simply doesn't back it up.https://twitter.com/ShireenQudosi/status/1139023857912729601 …

1139914850489053187.text: One the one hand anti-vaxxers irritate me for spreading misinformation, but on some level I can understand for some it's born from a genuine. concern. As utterly misguided as it is.

1139915663907180544.text: I met someone once whose child had been SEVERELY altered by a bad vaccine reaction. I think it’s possible ...but super rare.  Personally, I believe my sons were born autistic and you can track the genetic heritage through my family. (Me, my dad...)

1139919550701588480.text: I found this reply to be a rather compelling counterpoint to that thread.https://twitter.com/jillpromoli/status/1139893400541519872?s=19 …

1139915526254317568.text: (Note: by "no credible evidence" I mean no evidence. I just wanted to avoid the semantics of what is/isn't "evidence". There's no evidence vaccines cause autism.)

1139915978496761856.text: Adverse reactions to vaccines happen yeah, but they are very rare, and of those adverse reactions, autism isn't one that's ever been proven to be causally-linked to vaccines.

1139918435029327872.text:
I've also heard the hypothesis that traumatic events in early childhood (which arguably could describe vaccinations) could possibly trigger ASD. Not sure there's anything definitive to that yet, but it certainly offers another possible explanation.

https://www.omicsonline.org/open-access/autism-as-an-infantile-posttrauma-stress-disorder-a-hypothesis-2471-271X-1000142.php?aid=94266 …

1139919954021683200.text: Broadly speaking trauma shouldn't be ruled out as a cause, but a hypothesis is untested, so the medical community should continue to look for answers.

1139919218370109440.text:
I'm just so livid man, her entire diatribe is such an insult to both autists and parents with kids of any form of disability.

Is it hard taking care of a disabled kid? Probably, but to call them the slow death of a whole family is fucking horrid.

1140200356976222208.text:
I heard having retarded parents causes autism.

But there is a difference between being an anti-vaxxer and questioning the validity of a particular vaccine.

1139920068383518721.text:
That is even beside the point she is spewing deadly bullshit.

I mean yeah a classical autist with anger issues will be fucking difficult, you institutionalize them. But what is the issue with having a kid that'll be way into Pokémon forever or something. Gross.
